popt4jlib
Class BoolVector

java.lang.Object
  popt4jlib.BoolVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable
public class BoolVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable

represents a vector of booleans (alternative to BitSet, or Set<Long> that in fact may hold bit-sets of arbitrarily large size). Original version by Daniel Lemire on GitHub: https://github.com/lemire/Code-used-on-Daniel-Lemire-s-blog/blob/master/2012/11/13/src/StaticBitSet.java which however is now greatly enhanced with significantly more functionality. Notes:

  • The class is not thread-safe (to avoid paying locking costs). Clients must ensure no race-conditions exist when using this class.
  • 2016-01-27: The and(BoolVector), or(BoolVector) operations execute in parallel in the face of very large data lengths (above 1mio bits stored in both vectors to be and-ed). The implementation is modeled after the pattern in popt4jlib.MSSC.GMeansMTClusterer which turned out to be almost twice as fast as the generic parallel.ParallelBatchTaskExecutor.
  • 2017-02-10: The class is made serializable so that it can be used with graph.packing.DBBNode* to store the node-ids of a partial soln instead of using expensive HashSet's.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

nextSetBit

public int nextSetBit(int i)
method used to iterate over the set-bits in this vector. Use as in the following example: 
 
 for(int i=bv.nextSetBit(0); i>=0; i=bv.nextSetBit(i+1)) {
   // operate on index i
 }

Parameters:
i - int
Returns:
int -1 when there is no set bit after the input argument position.

lastSetBit

public int lastSetBit()
get the last bit position that is currently set.

Returns:
int will return -1 if no bit is set

and

public void and(BoolVector other)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
equivalent to the retainAll(set) operation on Set. Utilizes parallel processing when the _data array length is long enough.

or

public void or(BoolVector other)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
equivalent to the addAll(set) operation on Set. Utilizes parallel processing when the _data array length is long enough. The _data array will expand if necessary as a result of this operation.

Parameters:
other - BoolVector

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
element-wise comparison between two bit-vectors. empty vector comes first. If the argument has different size, then assuming the common data are the same, the vector with the less data-length comes first.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
Parameters:
o - Object // BoolVector
Returns:
int -1 if this vector comes before o in element-wise number order, 0 if they are the same

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
prints out the elements of _data as long values. Mostly used for debugging purposes.

Returns:
String
